remote.title: Remote
remote.serverConfiguration.title: Server Configuration
remote.serverConfiguration.remoteType.de: Choose the type of remote server.
remote.couchDB.serverURI.title: Server Address
remote.couchDB.serverURI.desc: The web address of your server running CouchDB. The address must begin with **https://** for mobile devices to connect.
remote.couchDB.useJWT.title: Use JWT (JSON Web Token)
remote.couchDB.useJWT.desc: Enable this if your server uses token-based authentication. When disabled, a username and password will be used instead.
remote.couchDB.jwtAlgorithm.title: Algorithm
remote.couchDB.jwtAlgorithm.desc: The algorithm you server uses for JWT authentication.
remote.couchDB.jwtKeypair.title: Keypair or Pre-shared Key
remote.couchDB.jwtKeypair.desc: The secret or private key used for JWT authentication. Use a base64-encoded key for HSxxx algorithms, or PEM private key for ESxxx algorithms.
remote.couchDB.jwtKeyID.title: Key ID
remote.couchDB.jwtKeyID.desc: The identifier for the key. This should match the "kid" field in CouchDB's jwt_keys.
remote.couchDB.jwtSubject.title: Subject (whoami)
remote.couchDB.jwtSubject.desc: The identity this JWT represents. Usually your username.
remote.couchDB.jwtRotationDuration.title: Rotation Duration
remote.couchDB.jwtRotationDuration.desc: The lifetime of each generated token, in minutes. Tokens will expire after this duration.
remote.couchDB.username.title: Username
remote.couchDB.username.desc: The username used to log in to the server.
remote.couchDB.password.title: Password
remote.couchDB.password.desc: The password used to log in to the server.
remote.couchDB.databaseName.title: Database Name
remote.couchDB.databaseName.desc: The name of the database on the server to connect to.
remote.couchDB.customHeaders.title: Custom Headers
remote.couchDB.customHeaders.desc:
Optional headers to include when making requests to CouchDB. For example:
x-custom-header1: value1
x-custom-header2: value2
remote.couchDB.useRequestAPI.title: Use Request API
remote.couchDB.useRequestAPI.desc: Enable to bypass CORS issues. This is less secure and may not work in all cases. Read the documentation before using.
remote.couchDB.testConnection.title: Test Database Connection
remote.couchDB.testConnection.desc: Attempts to connect to the database. If the database doesn't exist and you have the necessary permissions, it will be created.
remote.couchDB.validateConfig.title: Validate Database Configuration
remote.couchDB.validateConfig.desc: Checks the database configuration for potential issues and attempts to fix them.
remote.couchDB.applySettings.title: Apply Settings
remote.couchDB.applySettings.desc: Save and apply the current configuration to the database connection.
remote.bucket.endpointURL.title: Endpoint URL
remote.bucket.endpointURL.desc: The URL of the storage service endpoint where the bucket is hosted.
remote.bucket.region.title: Region
remote.bucket.region.desc: The region where the bucket is hosted.
remote.bucket.accessKey.title: Access Key
remote.bucket.accessKey.desc: The access key key used to authenticate with the bucket.
remote.bucket.secretKey.title: Secret Key
remote.bucket.secretKey.desc: The secret key used to authenticate with the bucket.
remote.bucket.bucketName.title: Bucket Name
remote.bucket.bucketName.desc: The name of the bucket to connect to.
remote.bucket.filePrefix.title: File Prefix
remote.bucket.filePrefix.desc: A folder-like prefixfor objects in the bucket. Should end with '/'. For example: 'vault-name/'
remote.bucket.forcePathStyle.title: Enable Force Path Style
remote.bucket.forcePathStyle.desc: Use this option to force path-style URLs for bucket operations. Typically needed for some S3-compatible services.
remote.bucket.customHTTPHandler.title: Use Custom HTTP Handler
remote.bucket.customHTTPHandler.desc: Enable if your object storage service doesn't support CORS.
remote.privacyAndEncryption.title: Privacy & Encryption
remote.privacyAndEncryption.endToEndEncr: Encrypts data on the remote server. Recommended if using synchronization features.
remote.privacyAndEncryption.passphrase.d:
The passphrase used to encrypt data.
Note: If changed, you'll need to overwrite the remote database with the newly encrypted data.
remote.privacyAndEncryption.propertyEncr:
Encrypts file properties on the remote database (ex. Paths, Size, Chunk IDs, etc).
Note: If using the V1 E2EE encryption method, only file paths will be encrypted.
remote.fetchSettingsFromRemote.title: Fetch Settings from Remote
remote.fetchSettingsFromRemote.fetchConf: Retrieve settings from an already configured.
remote.notifications.title: Notifications
remote.notifications.notifyStorageExceed:
If the remote server exceeds this threshold, you'll be notified.
Configured in MB (0 to disable)
